examples: He sat down to write, and occupied himself with certain papers, until there was a far-off sound of wheels: some vehicle was slowly entering the great gates; a craunch upon the gravel sweep.

entries.meaning: (mining) A portion of a stratum or vein left in excavating to support the roof.

verbs.description: craunch (third-person singular simple present craunches, present participle craunching, simple past and past participle craunched)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To crush with the teeth; to chew with violence and noise; to crunch.
